questions.question: What is the primary objective of a Red Team engagement?
Which phase of a Red Team operation involves gathering intelligence on the target organization?
What differentiates a Red Team from a traditional penetration test?
options: A. Red Teams simulate real-world adversaries
B. Penetration tests focus on compliance
C. Red Teams use only automated tools
D. Penetration tests always involve social engineering

questions.question: Which tool is commonly used in Red Team operations for command and control (C2)?
What is the primary goal of a Red Team during an engagement?
options: A. Evading detection and persisting in the environment
C. Ensuring compliance with security policies

questions.question: Which technique is commonly used by Red Teams to bypass authentication mechanisms?
What is lateral movement in the context of Red Teaming?
options: A. Moving between systems after initial access

questions.question: Which social engineering technique is most commonly used by Red Teams?
Which term refers to the defensive security team that responds to Red Team attacks?
What is an assumed breach scenario in Red Teaming?
options: A. Starting with initial access already granted
B. Testing only external perimeter defenses

questions.question: What is the purpose of a persistence mechanism in Red Teaming?
options: A. Maintaining long-term access to a compromised system
B. Removing logs after an attack

questions.question: Which technique helps Red Teams evade endpoint detection and response (EDR) solutions?
Which framework provides guidelines for Red Team operations?
What is the purpose of exfiltration in a Red Team exercise?
options: A. Stealing data from a target network

questions.question: Which term describes a collaborative exercise between Red and Blue Teams?
What is the main goal of initial access in a Red Team operation?
options: A. Gaining entry into a target system

questions.question: Which attack method is commonly used to escalate privileges?
Which scripting language is commonly used in Red Team operations?
Which type of attack is commonly used to exploit Active Directory?
Which protocol is often targeted to intercept sensitive data during Red Team engagements?
